coding_practice.title: Super Ugly Number
coding_practice.description:
A super ugly number is a positive integer whose prime factors are in the array primes.

Given an integer n and an array of integers primes, return the nth super ugly number.

The nth super ugly number is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit signed integer.

examples.explanation: [1,2,4,7,8,13,14,16,19,26,28,32] is the sequence of the first 12 super ugly numbers given primes = [2,7,13,19].
1 has no prime factors, therefore all of its prime factors are in the array primes = [2,3,5].

coding_practice.constraints:
1 <= n <= 10^5
1 <= primes.length <= 100
2 <= primes[i] <= 1000
primes[i] is guaranteed to be a prime number.
All the values of primes are unique and sorted in ascending order.
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 使用 ugly 列表保存目前已生成的 super ugly number，初始為 [1]。
2. indices 記錄每個 prime 的當前乘法位置。
3. vals 儲存每個 prime 對應當前乘的值。
4. 每次從 vals 中選最小值作為下一個 super ugly number，並更新對應 prime 的索引和值。
5. 重複 n-1 次，最後返回 ugly[-1]。
